trans-unit.source: Create EAI Logic App using VETR | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create EAI Logic App using VETR | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic covers the Validate, Encode and Transform features of BizTalk XML services.
trans-unit.target: This topic covers the Validate, Encode and Transform features of BizTalk XML services.

trans-unit.source: Most Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) scenarios mediate data between a source and a destination.
trans-unit.target: Most Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) scenarios mediate data between a source and a destination.

trans-unit.source: Such scenarios often have a common set of requirements:
trans-unit.target: Such scenarios often have a common set of requirements:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that data from different systems are correctly formatted
trans-unit.target: Ensure that data from different systems are correctly formatted

trans-unit.source: Perform “look-up” on incoming data to make decisions
trans-unit.target: Perform “look-up” on incoming data to make decisions

trans-unit.source: Convert data from one format to another (for example, from a CRM system's data format to an ERP system's data format)
trans-unit.target: Convert data from one format to another (for example, from a CRM system's data format to an ERP system's data format)

trans-unit.source: Route data to desired application or system
trans-unit.target: Route data to desired application or system

trans-unit.source: This article shows you a common integration pattern: "one-way message mediation" or VETR (Validate, Enrich, Transform, Route) The VETR pattern mediates data between a source entity and a destination entity.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you a common integration pattern: "one-way message mediation" or VETR (Validate, Enrich, Transform, Route) The VETR pattern mediates data between a source entity and a destination entity.

trans-unit.source: Usually the source and destination are data sources.
trans-unit.target: Usually the source and destination are data sources.

trans-unit.source: Consider a website that accepts orders.
trans-unit.target: Consider a website that accepts orders.

trans-unit.source: Users post orders to the system using HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Users post orders to the system using HTTP.

trans-unit.source: Behind the scenes, the system validates the incoming data for correctness, normalizes it, and persists it in a Service Bus queue for further processing.
trans-unit.target: Behind the scenes, the system validates the incoming data for correctness, normalizes it, and persists it in a Service Bus queue for further processing.

trans-unit.source: The system takes orders off the queue, expecting it in a particular format.
trans-unit.target: The system takes orders off the queue, expecting it in a particular format.

trans-unit.source: Thus, the end-to-end flow is:
trans-unit.target: Thus, the end-to-end flow is:

trans-unit.source: HTTP > Validate > Transform > Service Bus
trans-unit.target: HTTP > Validate > Transform > Service Bus

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Basic VETR Flow</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Basic VETR Flow</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The following BizTalk API Apps help build this pattern:
trans-unit.target: The following BizTalk API Apps help build this pattern:

trans-unit.source: HTTP Trigger - Source to trigger message event
trans-unit.target: HTTP Trigger - Source to trigger message event

trans-unit.source: Validate - Validates correctness of incoming data
trans-unit.target: Validate - Validates correctness of incoming data

trans-unit.source: Transform - Transforms data from incoming format to format required by downstream system
trans-unit.target: Transform - Transforms data from incoming format to format required by downstream system

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Connector - Destination entity where data is sent
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Connector - Destination entity where data is sent

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, click the +New button at the bottom-left of the screen and click Logic App.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, click the +New button at the bottom-left of the screen and click Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Choose a name, location, subscription, resource group, and location that works.
trans-unit.target: Choose a name, location, subscription, resource group, and location that works.

trans-unit.source: Resource groups act as containers for your apps and all of the resources for your app go to the same resource group.
trans-unit.target: Resource groups act as containers for your apps and all of the resources for your app go to the same resource group.

trans-unit.source: Next, let's add triggers and actions.
trans-unit.target: Next, let's add triggers and actions.

trans-unit.source: Select HTTP Listener from the gallery to create a new listener.
trans-unit.target: Select HTTP Listener from the gallery to create a new listener.

trans-unit.source: Call it HTTP1.
trans-unit.target: Call it HTTP1.

trans-unit.source: Leave Send response automatically? setting as false.
trans-unit.target: Leave Send response automatically? setting as false.

trans-unit.source: Configure the trigger action by setting HTTP Method to POST and setting Relative URL to /OneWayPipeline.
trans-unit.target: Configure the trigger action by setting HTTP Method to POST and setting Relative URL to /OneWayPipeline.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HTTP Trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HTTP Trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now, let’s enter actions that run whenever the trigger fires--that is, whenever a call is received on the HTTP endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Now, let’s enter actions that run whenever the trigger fires--that is, whenever a call is received on the HTTP endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Add BizTalk XML Validator from the gallery and name it (Validate1) to create an instance.
trans-unit.target: Add BizTalk XML Validator from the gallery and name it (Validate1) to create an instance.

trans-unit.source: Configure an XSD schema to validate the incoming XML messages.
trans-unit.target: Configure an XSD schema to validate the incoming XML messages.

trans-unit.source: Select the Validate action and select triggers(‘httplistener’).outputs.Content as the value for the inputXml parameter.
trans-unit.target: Select the Validate action and select triggers(‘httplistener’).outputs.Content as the value for the inputXml parameter.

trans-unit.source: Now, the validate action is the first action after the HTTP listener.
trans-unit.target: Now, the validate action is the first action after the HTTP listener.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, let's add the rest of the actions.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, let's add the rest of the actions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>BizTalk XML Validator</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>BizTalk XML Validator</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Let's configure transforms to normalize the incoming data.
trans-unit.target: Let's configure transforms to normalize the incoming data.

trans-unit.source: Add Transform from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: Add Transform from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: To configure a transform to transform the incoming XML messages, select the Transform action as the action to carry out when this API is called and select triggers(‘httplistener’).outputs.Content as the value for inputXml.
trans-unit.target: To configure a transform to transform the incoming XML messages, select the Transform action as the action to carry out when this API is called and select triggers(‘httplistener’).outputs.Content as the value for inputXml.

trans-unit.source: Map is an optional parameter since the incoming data is matched with all configured transforms, and only those that match the schema are applied.
trans-unit.target: Map is an optional parameter since the incoming data is matched with all configured transforms, and only those that match the schema are applied.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, the Transform runs only if Validate succeeds.
trans-unit.target: Lastly, the Transform runs only if Validate succeeds.

trans-unit.source: To configure this condition, click the gear icon on the top right and select Add a condition to be met.
trans-unit.target: To configure this condition, click the gear icon on the top right and select Add a condition to be met.

trans-unit.source: Set the condition to equals(actions('xmlvalidator').status,'Succeeded')
trans-unit.target: Set the condition to equals(actions('xmlvalidator').status,'Succeeded')

trans-unit.source: <linkText>BizTalk Transforms</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>BizTalk Transforms</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next, let's add the destination--a Service Bus Queu--to write data to.
trans-unit.target: Next, let's add the destination--a Service Bus Queu--to write data to.

trans-unit.source: Add a Service Bus Connector from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: Add a Service Bus Connector from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: Set the Name to Servicebus1, set Connection String* to the connection string to your service bus instance, set **Entity Name to Queue, and skip Subscription name.
trans-unit.target: Set the Name to Servicebus1, set Connection String* to the connection string to your service bus instance, set **Entity Name to Queue, and skip Subscription name.

trans-unit.source: Select the Send Message action and set the Message field for the action to actions('transformservice').outputs.OutputXml
trans-unit.target: Select the Send Message action and set the Message field for the action to actions('transformservice').outputs.OutputXml

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Service Bus</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Service Bus</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once pipeline processing is done, send back an HTTP response for both success and failure with the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Once pipeline processing is done, send back an HTTP response for both success and failure with the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Add an HTTP Listener from the gallery and select the Send HTTP Response action.
trans-unit.target: Add an HTTP Listener from the gallery and select the Send HTTP Response action.

trans-unit.source: Set Response Content to Pipeline processing completed, Response Status Code to 200 to indicate HTTP 200 OK, and Condition to the expression @equals(actions('servicebusconnector').status,'Succeeded')
trans-unit.target: Set Response Content to Pipeline processing completed, Response Status Code to 200 to indicate HTTP 200 OK, and Condition to the expression @equals(actions('servicebusconnector').status,'Succeeded')

trans-unit.source: Repeat the above steps to send an HTTP response on failure as well.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the above steps to send an HTTP response on failure as well.

trans-unit.source: Change Condition to @not(equals(actions('servicebusconnector').status,'Succeeded')).
trans-unit.target: Change Condition to @not(equals(actions('servicebusconnector').status,'Succeeded')).

trans-unit.source: Every time someone sends a message to the HTTP endpoint, it triggers the app and executes the actions you just created.
trans-unit.target: Every time someone sends a message to the HTTP endpoint, it triggers the app and executes the actions you just created.

trans-unit.source: To manage any such logic apps you create, click Browse in the Azure Management Portal and click Logic Apps.
trans-unit.target: To manage any such logic apps you create, click Browse in the Azure Management Portal and click Logic Apps.

trans-unit.source: Click on your app to see more information.
trans-unit.target: Click on your app to see more information.
